column4: need a developer to assist with E:Could not open file /tmp/aptdaemon-frozen-statusO5DmLB/status - open (2: No such file or directory), E:The package lists or status file could not be parsed or opened
what did you do?
attempted to download the updates amigo
How? did you try a sudo apt-get update ina terminal?
via Synaptic Update Manager
can you try: sudo apt-get update?
that appears to have worked. Gracias amigo!
When the automic update tool has a lock, you get this problem
there is a update, & the text reads "end", though when pressing "S" it reads "log file"
what should be entered?
still using snyptics? just do a: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
If you want to stay with synaptics, you'll have to ask somebody else, I don't like it and don't use it
it reads the same thing in the Terminal
normally it asks you if you want to upgrade the packages and you can accept with yes
can you paste the output
yes, then it stops with a /tmp location, then suggests "end" then posteri pressing "s" it reads "log file: "
-- Marc Deslauriers <marc.deslauriers@ubuntu.com>  Tue, 31 May 2011 05:48:25 -0400
log file:
hmm, no idea what's going wrong
have you some update applet in the panel?
am attempting to discern what to enter posteri "log file: "
I don't know, why not just enter something like /tmp/update.log?
but you /tmp directory exists?
